contest-event.event-date:
Nov. 9, 1897 D Australian Championships (A Grade)
Australian Championships (A Grade) 10 Sacred, March, Set Test and Own Choice Contest Australian Championships australian-championships-a-grade
Australia
A Grade
Own Choice Test Piece Contest
Sydney Town Hall, Sydney, New South Wales, Australia Prizes: 1st - £100/$200 + Besson Silver Cup, valued 50 guineas + Boosey Challenge Cup, valued 30 guineas + gold medal for conductor 2nd - £50/$100 3rd - £20/$40
Championship held from Thu 4th Nov to Tue 9th Nov; this was the first contest advertised as for the "Championship of Australia", and as such is regarded as the first in the current sequence of Australian National Championships. 8 bands played. Points awarded out of 60.
Solo prizes: Eb cornet: E. Walters, Parramatta Bb Cornet: W. H. Fleetman, Sydney Tenor horn: J. Arcus, Sydney
Feb. 14, 2016, 9:38 p.m. Feb. 15, 2016, 4:31 p.m.
1 Queenstown Band Thomas Hopkins Rossini [arr. Round]
2 Naval Artillery Volunteers ( Sydney) Jack Charlesworth Tannhäuser [unknown arranger]
3 Sydney Model John Devlin Rienzi [unknown arranger]
4 Parramatta Model George O'Shea Souvenir de Bellini
5 NSW Railway Military Band Charles Helm Bellini [arr. Round]
5 Armidale City Band Alfred Lovell Euryanthe [unknown arranger]
7 Newtown Band [Australia] Thomas Mellor Selection from Weber [arr. Round]
8 Zeehan Military (Tas) Alf Caddie Zaar und Zimmermann
Withdrawn Bathurst Military Unknown
